title: Feature request: set the artifcat-root when creating an experiment programmatically.
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: macOS High Sierra Version 10.13.6
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary (using pip)
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 0.3
- **Python version**: 2.7.10
- **npm version (if running the dev UI):
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 


### Describe the problem
I need to set the `artifcat-root` to a remote one (S3 store) while creating a new experiment using the `mlflow.create_experiment` method. Inspecting the code of this method, it seem that the only argument is `experiment_name`. 
I was able to change the `artifcat-root` default by creating an experiment using the command line `mlflow experiments create <experiment-name> --artifact-store <remote/artifact/store>` then using the  `mflow.create_experiment(<experiment-name>)`. 
Maybe it is possible to change the `artifcat-root` by using the `mlflow.set_tracking_uri`? If that is the case, then the method name is a little bit confusing (I though it was responsible for only changing where the metrics and logs are stored, i.e. the `file-store`). 

Thanks in advance. Let me know if you need more details.
